author: jacobkaufmann
content: yea, but it matters to the extent that other clients that want to join the focil devnet have the fulu stuff available, and whether or not it's trivial to remove/deactivate peerdas from fulu

author: jih2nn
content: This is awesome. After creating censoring client, I'll be working on modifying Dora to show IL per slot for easier debugging, and I'll keep this mind!

author: potuz
content: We kept our codebase as ePBS until it became 7732 and then used that number for forks. Same as in the CL_spec, should be simple to call this fork by EIP number

author: parithosh
content: Yup this would be perfect and work for us too

author: jih2nn
content: Found a bug. I'll share it with fixed versions some time later today. We're getting close!

author: terence0083
content: Yep agree this is the way to go. Unfortunately FOCIL doesnt make any changes to block and state structure so making a seperate version require more work considering edge cases as such. I'll do it this week

author: jih2nn
content:
Fixed bugs. The naive version of interop between Prysm and Geth is done. Naive as in all participants are honest. We now use NewPayloadV5 with non-empty ILs. I'll wrap this up and share a write up with code tomorrow.

```[cl-1-prysm-geth] time="2025-01-21 17:49:34" level=info msg="NewPayloadMethodV5 result status:VALID latest_valid_hash:"B\x1d6`\x89f\xfeB\nqT\x1e\xd7\xf0@\x93&\x02\xb4쭅\xc7#в\x1f\xc4\xce\x1c\xc9\xe6"" prefix=execution```

author: jacobkaufmann
content: coming back to this, I would urge that we keep FOCIL on top of electra, not part of fulu or some separate activation epoch

author: terence0083
content: I don't have a strong preference. Any other client teams want to chime in? I think for mid to long term we want focil epoch and version on its own for cleaness

author: nc1234
content: Slight preference for focil or 7805 fork for the ease of testing but Lodestar is flexible on this

author: terence0083
content: I think if we want to take this seriously, we should use the FOCIL epoch number and version. If we want something quick and dirty, we can overload the Electra fork, but that won’t get us too far. It’s not clear to me what we’re optimizing here, and we still have some time before making a decision

author: jacobkaufmann
content: wdym when you say it won't get us too far?

author: terence0083
content: spec tests, tooling geration, if put FOCIL under electra then some of those will fail. It's not a good long term solution
